alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Grady; Stephens; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 1:41AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Comanche, southwestern Grady, southeastern Caddo, northwestern Stephens and east central Tillman Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 141 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Ellsworth to near Fort Sill to near Lawton to 4 miles northeast of Faxon. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawton, Cache, Elgin, Apache, Geronimo, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, Cement, Medicine Park, Norge, Faxon, Lake Lawtonka, Fort Sill, Lake Ellsworth, Central High, Ninnekah, Acme and Laverty. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 28 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
